Participants.evidence: Nineteen patients with isolated unresectable liver metastases from a variety of tumors

Intervention.evidence: treated with a 60-min IHP using 200 mg melphalan

Objective.evidence: We report the results of our experience with isolated hepatic perfusion (IHP) in patients with isolated liver metastases from a variety of primary tumors.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were monitored for toxicity, response according to response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST) criteria, and survival.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Nineteen patients with isolated unresectable liver metastases

Number_Analysed.evidence: One melanoma patient was not perfused due to insufficient isolation of the liver.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median disease-free survival was 6.6 months with a median overall survival of 10.0 months.

Harms.evidence: Reversible grade 3 or 4 hepatoxicity occurred in 10 (56%) patients, while veno-occlusive disease occurred in 4 (22%) patients.
